Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: Review of Russian Hot Drinks Market Research of the Company “Professional Complex Solutions” (“PKR”) In 2010 production of coffee in Russia constituted about RUR 26 billion, plus 12% over previous year. Production of tea in Russia also saw year-to-year increase in value terms – by 8% – and constituted about RUR 30 billion. COFFEE Stimulating effect of coffee was first recognized approximately in 850 CE, however popularity came to this invigorating beverage hundreds of years later. Instant coffee is believed to be “born” on July 24, 1938. This highly popular drink was invented by Swiss chemist Max Morgenthaler. He adopted experience of Japanese scientist Satori Kato – inventor of powder tea. However, at first neither experts nor consumers valued taste, flavor and convenience of instant coffee. Maybe the world would have never accepted this novelty but for the Second World War. The army needed a lot of easy-to-brew coffee so invention of Max Morgenthaler got its second chance. Instant coffee was very popular among soldiers because they could have their cup of coffee right in entrenchments
